title: Calendar | Clay Today
body_text:
Posted 9/7/23
CLAY COUNTY DEVELOPMENT REVIEW COMMITTEE: will meet on Sept. 14 at 10 a.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
LAKE REGION KIWANIS: will meet on Sept. 14 at 7:30 a.m. at the Montgomery Center, 88 SE 75th St. in Starke.
AARON TIPPIN, COLIN RAYE AND SAMMY KERSHAW: will bring their Roots and Boots Tour to the Thrasher-Horne Center, 283 College Dr. in Orange Park, on Sept. 15 at 7:30 p.m. Tickets start at $39 and are available at thcenter.org.
MIND-BODY YOGA: will be on Sept. 15 at 9 a.m. at the Fleming Island Library, 1895 Town Center Blvd. The session is free and open to the public.
This item is available in full to subscribers.
To continue reading, you will need to either log in to your subscriber account, below, or purchase a new subscription.
Posted
CLAY COUNTY DEVELOPMENT REVIEW COMMITTEE: will meet on Sept. 14 at 10 a.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
LAKE REGION KIWANIS: will meet on Sept. 14 at 7:30 a.m. at the Montgomery Center, 88 SE 75th St. in Starke.
AARON TIPPIN, COLIN RAYE AND SAMMY KERSHAW: will bring their Roots and Boots Tour to the Thrasher-Horne Center, 283 College Dr. in Orange Park, on Sept. 15 at 7:30 p.m. Tickets start at $39 and are available at thcenter.org.
MIND-BODY YOGA: will be on Sept. 15 at 9 a.m. at the Fleming Island Library, 1895 Town Center Blvd. The session is free and open to the public.
THOMAS RHETT’S HOMETOWN TOUR: will be at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, 300 A. Philip Randolph Blvd. in Jacksonville on Sept. 15 at 7:30 p.m. Special guests include Cole Swindell and Nate Smith. Tickets, which start at $40.50, are available at axs.com.
JACKSONVILLE SYMPHONY: will perform two Community Concerts on Sept. 15 and 16 at 7:30 p.m. in Jacoby Symphony Hall, 300 Water St., Jacksonville. The shows will preview the season’s musical offerings. The concerts are free, and to claim tickets, visit JaxSymphony.org.
HICKORY TRAIL NATURE HIKE: will be on Sept. 16 at 9:30 a.m. at Camp Chowenwaw, 1517 Ball Road in Green Cove Springs. The event is free. Bring bug spray, bottled water and closed-toe shoes. You can register at forms.office.com/g/rnPhXtPeBG.
VINEYARD TRANSITIONAL CENTER BOSTON BUTT PRELAUNCH: will be on Sept. 16 from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. at 518 Pine St. in Green Cove Springs. The event will allow residents to pre-order their smoked Thanksgiving Boston Butt which will benefit the center’s building fundraising project. Free pork sliders with sides and music from Ashton Taylor will be featured. Call Pastor John Sanders at (904) 305-4641 or Joseph Smith at (904) 343-1869 for more information.
ORANGE PARK HISTORICAL SOCIETY ROAD TRIP: is Sept. 16 at 9:30 a.m. Members will meet at the parking lot of Orange Park Town Hall and carpool to the Florida Agriculture Museum in Palm Coast for a 90-minute tour of the museum, including a fully-stocked general store, five buildings from a citrus complex, a 1920s dairy barn and a brief wagon ride to an authentic Florida Cracker Homestead and Florida Cracker Livestock. Tour costs $12. Visit ophistory.org for more information.
LIL BABY’S IT’S ONLY US TOUR: will be at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, 300 A. Philip Randolph Blvd. in Jacksonville on Sept. 16 at 7 p.m. Special guests include Glorilla, Rylo Rodriguez, Gloss Up and Hunxho. Tickets, which start at $56.50, are available at axs.com.
KEYSTONE HEIGHTS HERITAGE COMMISSION: will meet on Sept. 19 at 10 a.m. at City Hall, 555 S. Lawrence Blvd.
LAKE REGION KIWANIS: will meet on Sept. 21 at 6 p.m. Clyde’s Cozy Corner Café, 195 S. Lawrence Blvd. in Keystone Heights.
CLAY COUNTY DEVELOPMENT REVIEW COMMITTEE: will meet on Sept. 21 at 10 a.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
FLORIDA REP. BOBBY PAYNE: will hold office hours on Sept. 21 from 9 a.m.-noon at Keystone Heights City Hall, 555 S. Lawrence Blvd. For more information, call Tammy Still at (352) 732-1244 or email her at tammy.still@myfloridahouse.gov.
CLAY COUNTY TOURIST DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL GRANT SUBCOMMITTEE: will meet on Sept. 21 at 9 a.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
BRETT YOUNG: with special guests Jake Scott and Griffen Palmer will play on Sept. 21 at 7 p.m. at the Saint Augustine Amphitheatre, 1340C A1A South. Tickets, which start at $39, are available at ticketmaster.com.
MIND-BODY YOGA: will be on Sept. 22 at 9 a.m. at the Fleming Island Library, 1895 Town Center Blvd. The session is free and open to the public.
NE-YO: CHAMPAGNE AND ROSES TOUR: will be on Sept. 22 with special guest Robin Thicke and Mario at Daily’s Place Amphitheater, 1 Daily’s Place in Jacksonville adjacent to EverBank Stadium on Sept. 13 at 7:30 p.m. For tickets, which start at $49.95, are available at ticketmaster.com.
PLAIN WHITE T’S: will play on Sept. 23 at 8 p.m. at the Thrasher-Horne Center, 283 College Dr. in Orange Park. Tickets, which start at 39, are available at thcenter.org.
WU-TANG AND NAS: NY STATE OF MIND TOUR: will be on Sept. 23 with special guest De La Soul at 8 p.m. at Daily’s Place Amphitheater, 1 Daily’s Place in Jacksonville adjacent to EverBank Stadium on Sept. 13 at 7:30 p.m. For tickets, which start at $49.95, are available at ticketmaster.com.
YONDER MOUNTAIN STRING BAND, RAILROAD EARTH, KELLER AND KEELS: will play at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre, 1340C A1A South at 6 p.m. on Sept. 23. This event is sold out.
UF/IFAS EXTENSION GARDENING ADVICE SERIES: will focus on how to properly dispose of yard debris and protect Florida’s waters on Sept. 25 from 11:30 a.m.-12:30 p.m. at the Extension Office, 2463 State Road 16 in Green Cove Springs. For more information, call (904) 284-6355 or email whhobbs@ufl.edu.
THOMAS RHETT: HOMETEAM TOUR 23: will be on Sept. 25 at 7:30 p.m. at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, 300 A. Philip Randolph Blvd., Jacksonville. Tickets are available at ticketmaster.com.
CLAY COUNTY SCHOOL BOARD: will conduct a workshop Sept. 26 at 9 a.m. in the Multi-Purpose Center at H.C. Long Building, 23 Green St. in Green Cove Springs.
CLAY COUNTY BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS: will meet on Sept. 26 at 4 p.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
CLAY COUNTY BOARD OF ADJUSTMENT will meet on Sept. 28 at 6 p.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
CLAY COUNTY DEVELOPMENT REVIEW COMMITTEE: will meet on Sept. 28 at 10 a.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
LAKE REGION KIWANIS: will meet on Sept. 28 at 7:30 a.m. at the Montgomery Center, 88 SE 75th St. in Starke.
MIND-BODY YOGA: will be on Sept. 29 at 9 a.m. at the Fleming Island Library, 1895 Town Center Blvd. The session is free and open to the public.
CARIN LEON’S COLMILLO DE LECHE TOUR: will be at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, 300 A. Philip Randolph Blvd. in Jacksonville on Sept. 29 at 8 p.m. Tickets, which start at $75, are available at axs.com.
JUNIOR WOMEN’S CLUB OF KEYSTONE HEIGHTS: will host its second annual Almost Fall Festival on Sept. 30 from 9 a.m.-2 p.m. at the Keystone Heights Woman’s Club, 6747 Women’s Club Drive. There will be more than 60 vendors.
KEYSTONE HEIGHTS CITY COUNCIL: will meet on Oct. 2 at 6 p.m. at City Hall, 555 S. Lawrence Blvd.
NATIONAL NIGHT OUT: is on Oct. 3 from 5-9 p.m. The Clay County Sheriff’s Office will have deputies on hand to share information to promote community partnerships and neighborhood camaraderie.
CLAY COUNTY PLANNING COMMISSION: will meet on Oct. 3 at 5 p.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
DUSTIN LYNCH: THE 2023 FURYK FOUNDATION CONCERT: will be on Oct. 3 at 7 p.m. at Daily’s Place Amphitheater, 1 Daily’s Place in Jacksonville adjacent to EverBank Stadium on Sept. 13 at 7:30 p.m. For tickets, which start at $29.95, are available at ticketmaster.com.
ALICE COOPER: will play Oct. 4 at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre, 1340C A1A South at 8 p.m. Tickets, which start at $44.50, are available at the venue’s box office or at ticketmaster.com.
LYNYRD SKYNYRD: will play Oct. 5 with The Curt Towne Band at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre, 1340C A1A South at 7:30 p.m. Tickets, which start at $65, are available at the venue’s box office or at ticketmaster.com.
CLAY CHAMBER AWARDS GALA: will be on Oct. 5 at 5:30 p.m. at The Hilltop Club, 2023 Wells Road in Orange Park. To buy tickets, visit claychamber.com.
CLAY COUNTY HISTORIC PRESERVATION BOARD: will meet on Oct. 5 at 5:30 p.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
LAKE REGION KIWANIS: will meet on Oct. 5 at 7:30 a.m. at the Montgomery Center, 88 SE 75th St. in Starke.
LYNYRD SKYNYRD: will play Oct. 6 with The Curt Towne Band at the St. Augustine Amphitheatre, 1340C A1A South at 7:30 p.m. Tickets, which start at $65, are available at the venue’s box office or at ticketmaster.com.
MIDDLEBURG GARDEN CLUB: will host its monthly meeting on Oct. 6 from 9:30-11 a.m. at the Watson Realty Building, 2239 Blanding Blvd. Light refreshments, a raffle, educational demonstrations and resources, gardening tips, plant trades, sales, and civic projects will be featured. For more information, call (904) 343-8235 or email gardenclubofmiddleburg@hotmail.com.
FOOD TRUCK FRIDAY: will be on Oct. 6 from 5-9:30 p.m. at Spring Park in Green Cove Springs. There will be several food trucks and live music by Fat Cactus. Bring your own chair and cooler to the free event.
MARKET AND MUSIC AT THE COVE PLAZA: will be on Oct. 7 from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. at 1415 S. Orange Ave. in Green Cove Springs. Fresh produce, food trucks, home décor, music, jewelry and hourly giveaway will be offered. For more information, email showcaseevents17@gmail.com.
JON PARDI: MR. SATURDAY NIGHT WORLD TOUR: will be on Oct. 7 at 7 p.m. with special guests Midland, Ella Langley and DJ Highmax at Daily’s Place Amphitheater, 1 Daily’s Place in Jacksonville adjacent to EverBank Stadium on Sept. 13 at 7:30 p.m. For tickets, which start at $29.75, are available at ticketmaster.com.
CLARKE HOUSE TOURS: will be on Oct. 8 from 2-4 p.m. at Clarke House Park, 1039 Kingsley Ave. in Orange Park. The house was built in 1912 and guests are invited to tour the house.
KIRK FRANKLIN’S THE REUNION TOUR: will be at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, 300 A. Philip Randolph Blvd. in Jacksonville on Oct. 8 at 8 p.m. Special guests include New Breed, The Family and God’s Property. Tickets, which start at $32, are available at ticketmaster.com.
NOAH KAHAN’S THE STICK SEASON TOUR: will be at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, 300 A. Philip Randolph Blvd. in Jacksonville on Oct. 9 at 8 p.m. Special guest includes Samia. Tickets, which start at $92, are available at ticketmaster.
CLAY COUNTY BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS: will meet on Oct. 10 at 4 p.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
LAKE ASBURY/PENNEY FARMS ADVISORY COMMITTEE: will meet on Oct. 11 at 6 p.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
LAKE REGION KIWANIS: will meet on Oct. 12 at 7:30 a.m. at the Montgomery Center, 88 SE 75th St. in Starke.
JELLY ROLL’S BACKROAD BAPTISM TOUR: will be at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, 300 A. Philip Randolph Blvd. in Jacksonville on Oct. 13 at 7:30 p.m. Special guests include Chase Rice and Struggle Jennings. Tickets, which start at $91, are available at ticketmaster.com.
ST. LUKE CATHOLIC CHURCH: will host its Food Giveaway on Oct. 14 from 9 a.m.-noon at 1606 Blanding Blvd. in Middleburg. For more information, visit stlukesparish.org or ccbjax.org.
BERT KREISHER’S TOPS OFF WORLD TOUR: will be at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, 300 A. Philip Randolph Blvd. in Jacksonville on Oct. 14 at 7 p.m. Tickets, which start at $36.75, are available at bertbertbert.com and ticketmaster.com.
LAKE REGION KIWANIS: will meet on Oct. 19 at 6 p.m. Clyde’s Cozy Corner Café, 195 S. Lawrence Blvd. in Keystone Heights.
FLORIDA REP. BOBBY PAYNE: will hold office hours on Oct. 19 from 9 a.m.-noon at Keystone Heights City Hall, 555 S. Lawrence Blvd. For more information, call Tammy Still at (352) 732-1244 or email her at tammy.still@myfloridahouse.gov.
LONESTAR: will perform on Oct. 20 at 7:30 p.m. at the Thrasher-Horne Center, 283 College Dr. in Orange Park. Tickets, which start at $29, are available at thcenter.org.
GABRIEL IGLESIAS’S DON’T WORRY, BE FLUFFY TOUR: will be at the VyStar Veterans Memorial Arena, 300 A. Philip Randolph Blvd. in Jacksonville on Oct. 20 at 8 p.m. Tickets, which start at $59.50, are available at ticketmaster.com.
BUDDY GUY’S DAMN RIGHT FAREWELL: with special guest Christone “Kingfish” Ingram will play on Oct. 20 at 7:30 p.m. at the Saint Augustine Amphitheatre, 1340C A1A South. Tickets, which start at $44, are available at ticketmaster.com.
ROTARY CLUB OUTDOOR ADVENTURE VENDOR SHOW: will be on Oct. 21 from 9 a.m.-5 p.m. at the Clay County Shrine Club, 2471 Russell Road in Green Cove Springs. Call Sandra at (904) 923-9884 or Susan at (904) 631-2156 to reserve a vendor space.
WETLANDS NATURE HIKE: will be on Oct. 21 at 9:30 a.m. at Camp Chowenwaw, 1517 Ball Road in Green Cove Springs. The event is free. Bring bug spray, bottled water and closed-toe shoes. You can register at forms.office.com/g/ZSr2DZbBrz.
BETHUNE-COOKMAN VS. SOUTHERN: college football game will be on Oct. 21 at EverBank Stadium, 1 EverBank Stadium Blvd., in Jacksonville. Tickets, which start at $25, are available at ticketmaster.com.
UF/IFAS EXTENSION GARDENING ADVICE SERIES: will focus on caring for gardening tools and winter on Oct. 23 from 11:30 a.m.-12:30 p.m. at the Extension Office, 2463 State Road 16 in Green Cove Springs. For more information, call (904) 284-6355 or email whhobbs@ufl.edu.
CLAY COUNTY BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS: will meet on Oct. 24 at 4 p.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
BILLY OCEAN: will be at the Thrasher-Horne Center, 283 College Dr. in Orange Park, on Oct. 25 at 7:30 p.m. Tickets, which start at $39, are available at thcenter.org.
LAKE REGION KIWANIS: will meet on Oct. 26 at 7:30 a.m. at the Montgomery Center, 88 SE 75th St. in Starke.
CLAY COUNTY BOARD OF ADJUSTMENT will meet on Oct. 26 at 6 p.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
SAMMY HAGAR AND THE CIRCLE: with George Thorogood and the Destroyers and Damon Fowler will play on Oct. 26 at 6:30 p.m. at the Saint Augustine Amphitheatre, 1340C A1A South. Tickets, which start at $49, are available at ticketmaster.com.
BOO ON THE BOULEVARD: will be all day on Oct. 28 in Keystone Heights. The event includes trick-or-treating along Lawrence Boulevard, food trucks, games and a movie at Keystone Beach.
MOONLIGHT ON MAGNOLIA: will be on Oct. 28, starting at 4 p.m. at the Magnolia Cemetary, 1040 Kingsley Ave. in Orange Park. The free event includes a tour of the cemetary to visit “former residents.” If you’d like to participate, contact info@ophistory.org.
CLAY COUNTY HISTORIC PRESERVATION BOARD: will meet on Nov. 2 at 5:30 p.m. at the BCC Meeting Room, fourth floor, at Administration Building, 477 Houston St. in Green Cove Springs.
LAKE REGION KIWANIS: will meet on Nov. 2 at 7:30 a.m. at the Montgomery Center, 88 SE 75th St. in Starke.
GREATER JACKSONVILLE AGRICULTURE FAIR: will run from Nov. 2-12 at the Greater Jacksonville Agriculture Fairgrounds and Expo Center, 510 Fairgrounds Place. Admission tickets are $12 for adults, $6 for children 6-12 and seniors and children 5 and younger are free. Admission is good for the fairgrounds, concerts and exhibits. Rides require separate tickets.
FOOD TRUCK FRIDAY: will be on Nov. 3 from 5-9:30 p.m. at Spring Park in Green Cove Springs. There will be several food trucks and live music. Bring your chair and cooler to the free event.
